event.title: you give a title to the video to give a brief description of it, must be in English!
event.date: the date when the event starts, you can simply set the date without the time (leave it at 00:00 midnight), to also add specific seconds in special cases (such as the explosion of the reactor at 1h23m44s).
event.langs-description: write you the description of the event, what happened, why, or ...ect, this will be used in the texts displayed in the timeline.
event.langs-title: you give a title to the video to give a brief description of it, in the language select

video.title: you give a title to the video to give a brief description of it. must be in English
video.video: the link of the video, you can put a youtube link, peertube ( all the others are not tested )
video.langs-title: you give a title to the video to give a brief description of it, in the language select
video.date: this is the date (approximate or precise) on which the video was taken

translate.description:
you can help to translate this site!
On this page you will find under each category the texts to be translated (names of menus, buttons, help messages for content creation, etc.).

picture.langs-title: you give a title to the video to give a brief description of it, in the language select
picture.title: you give a title to the video to give a brief description of it, must be in English!
picture.photographer: you can inform the person who took this picture (e.g. Igor Kostine for example).
picture.date: this is the date (approximate or precise) on which the photo was taken
picture.picture: you upload an image of the best possible quality

people.wikipedia: a link to wikipedia if there is one
people.biography: a biography of this person, his life ... ect.
people.born: the date on which he or she was born
people.name: the name and surname of the person
people.profil: a photo showing him from the front.
people.death: the date on which he is deceased

about.description: This site recounts the events of the accident that led to this disaster and its consequences, illustrated by photo, video and archive document.
about.creator-description: Web developer based in Lyon (France) and passionate about the history of Chernobyl. I was interested in the consequences and sacrifices that the citizens of the USSR had to go through in order to mitigate the harmful effects of this cataclysm. This is why I have created this site, in order to keep their stories alive and not to forget what these men and women have done for us, and for future generations.
about.help-us-description: This site is free, open-source and will remain so! Why should you help me? Currently, the annual cost of the infrastructure is 200 euros. To help me meet this cost, and on a voluntary basis, I am making available a kitty on which you can help me. Of course, if the money accumulated is greater than the expenses initially generated. I will use this money to improve the service offered, and why not, add a storage facility for the videos.

contact.title: contact
contact.description: you can contact me for any request, I will answer you as soon as possible!

login.description: connect to chernobyle.org to contribute to the community, and share your photo, video and much more!
login.title: connection

register.description: join the chernobyle.org community to share your photo, video and much more!
register.title: registration

video.description: a huge gallery of period videos on the whole history of Chernobyl, from the construction, to the video of the explosion of the reactor, to the liquidators.
video.title: video gallery

home.title: chernobyl.org
home.description: The Chernobyl nuclear disaster is a major nuclear accident that occurred on April 26, 1986 in the V.I. Lenin nuclear power plant, then located in the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic, USSR. It is the most serious nuclear disaster of the 20th century, classified at level 7 (the highest) of the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES), surpassing, according to the Institute for Radiation Protection and Nuclear Safety (IRSN), by its immediate environmental impacts the Fukushima nuclear accident of 2011, classified at the same level. The IRSN mentions for these accidents potential health effects, lasting contamination of territories and important economic and social consequences.

picture.description: a huge gallery of period photos on the whole history of Chernobyl, from the construction, to the photo of the explosion of the reactor, through the liquidators.
picture.title: image gallery
